thread.title: Matt Machan signs new three-year contract with Sussex
thread.title_full: Matt Machan signs new three-year contract with Sussex

title: Matt Machan signs new three-year contract with Sussex
text:
Matt Machan signs new three-year contract with Sussex 22 Oct 2015 08:46:53 
comments 
Sussex batsman Matt Machan has signed a new three-year contract that will see him remain in Hove until the end of the 2018 season. 
The 24-year-old left-hander, who made his first-class debut with the county in 2010, accumulated 955 runs in the LV= County Championship this summer at an average of 39.79. 
That included three centuries, although his runs could not help Sussex avoid relegation from Division One. 
Machan, who has also played for Scotland 28 times in the shorter formats and featured in this year's World Cup, said: "I'm absolutely delighted. I've played at the club since I was 10 and to sign for at least another three years is fantastic. 
"I obviously want to play for Sussex and I feel the club is moving forward with a young squad. Three years definitely gives me that security to try and become a real senior player at this club, and to kick on next year and win games of cricket for Sussex." Related Sport News
